headline: Oprah, Apple and the Decision to Exit a #MeToo Documentary
abstract: Ms. Winfrey acknowledged that Russell Simmons pushed her to abandon a documentary about his accusers, but said her own concerns led her to pull support.
lead_paragraph: For months, the filmmakers Kirby Dick and Amy Ziering had a pair of dream partners: Oprah Winfrey and Apple, who had committed to back their documentary about women who have accused the hip-hop mogul Russell Simmons of sexual misconduct. Booked for the Sundance Film Festival and Appleâ€™s new streaming platform, the film was primed to be the next high-profile media moment of the #MeToo era.
